On the 'Theatre' (17m10s) stage is Chris 'Pinchak', Jon 'CanuckSoldier' Ryder and Cartimandua relaying recent CivIV triumphs and disappointments. 'Forum Talk' (23m39s) goes over how the defensive bonus with culture in CivIV is a sticking point for one of the co-hosts and adding a limit on the era of Vassals. The 'Research Lab' (30m23s) experiments with splitting civilizations in-game and the concept of a megaopolis. Then in the 'Senate', the importance of blockades in CivIV with the BtS expansion.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: ModCast #11: Kael Spectacular
item.description: In the Code Corner (02:40), we talked about Kael's Speed Mod. In the Artists Sketchpad (05:42), we looked at the Darkelf Black Guard by Ploeperpengel and the Shinto Mod by Dual. In the Cartography Room (14:02), we looked at Fractal Arboria and BtS Creation Mapscripts, both by Junuxx. In the Spotlight (20:17), we featured Derek Paxton and talked alot about the development of FfH2 and too much more to even list here!
item.itunes:author: Apolyton Civilization Site (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #45: Answer to Everything
item.description: In the 'News' (03m26s) Apple is now profiling Sid Meier. The 'Research Lab' (05m17s) investigates an argument for random religion by event, responds to a Corporate victory condition by listener request and reviews some player wishlists for a Civilization V. 'Forum Talk' (21m54s) considers the position that since the Beyond the Sword expansion, space sabotage is 'outrageous' in Civilization IV. Over in the 'Senate' (25m46s), countering archery units effectively and best offenses and defenses for nuclear weapons. Accessing the 'Vault' (34m52s) has the Christmas Special 2007 panelists relating their relatives' gameplay experiences with the Civilization franchise. Then in the 'Mailbag' (38m49s), going over the first known mention of the podcast in print in a special CivIV edition of a French-language strategy gaming magazine.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: ModCast #10: Code-tards
item.description: In the Code Corner (02m30s), we talked about AIAutoplay by jdog5000, Enhanced City Size by Mylon, and Holy Wars by Kailric. In the Artists Sketchpad (19m20s), we looked at the International Space Station by The_Coyote. In the Spotlight (25m45s), we featured John Palcheck and talked with him about his Nextwar Mod Mod and his Random Events mod and much more.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton Civilization Site (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast 'Focus: Alpha Centauri'
item.description: A feature discussion with four representatives from the fiction and modding sectors of the 'Alpha Centauri' community on this turn-based, space-set strategy game released more than nine years ago. Topic headings are 'Introductions' (01m41s), 'Style' (04m51s), 'Gameplay' (21m08s), 'Fiction' (39m10s), 'Modding' (54m31s) and 'Remarks' (67m51s).
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #44: Holy Mackerel
item.description: In the 'News' (03m41s) Infogrames is set to buy the outstanding shares of Atari, and the prospects of online validation for games every 10 days. In the 'Research Lab' (13m19s), considering scrapping the Fat-X city radius in the Civilization series and the testing ground that will be Revolution in this respect. Over in the 'Senate' (18m43s) is warfare, and indeed warmongering, too important in Civ IV. In 'Forum Talk' (24m09s), removing or at least modifying global warming and its effects, on hydro power and such, and what's new to know that's coming in Civ Rev. Then in opening the 'Vault', THG being set to buy Brian Reynolds' Big Huge Games and a Top 10 list for 'Things I Learned About the Science of Warfare' through Civ IV.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: ModCast #09: FfH The Movie
item.description: In the 'Artist's Sketchpad' (02m29s), two units from seZereth are profiled, the WWI Infantry and Elven Female, and lastly Idi Amin by Ekmek. Next in the 'Cartography Room' (20m58s), detailing the Full of Resources Map Script by Sto with discussion led by GarretSidzaka. Then in the 'Spotlight' (29m08s), Stephan 'seZereth' Weiss from the Fall from Heaven MOD team on his artwork and the past, present and future of FfH itself.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton Civilization Site (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #43: Mouth to Mouth
item.description: In the 'News' (01m49s), there's not just one or even two new previews of Civilization Revolution but three. Then there are the release date changes. In 'Forum Talk' (06m15s), exploring after initial expansion and enabling wineries in Civilization IV. Over in the 'Senate' (15m35s) are Courthouses worth building and how are Paratroopers useful in the game. Featured in the 'Interview' (29m15s) once more is Bruce 'Beta' Hynes in the second of a two-parter about the CivIV Beyond the Sword Democracy Game (BtSDG) whose start is all but imminent on Apolyton. Then in the 'Research Lab' (37m15s), how to make colonies sensible in CivIV.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: ModCast #08: Nice Nipples
item.description: In the News (02m28s), we talk about Brad Wardell, of Stardock and Galactic Civilizations II fame, being interviewed on GFW Radio (show of 04/02/2008). In the Artist Sketchpad (12m31s), we discuss NikNaks93's Meso-American and Native American Explorers, the Tuskaloosa leaderhead by johny smith (as well as a different version by mourndraken), and Ekmek's Akbar the Great leader and Venetian civilization. In the Code Corner (31m51s), we're looking at a new map making tool called simply Civ4 Map Maker by sarysa and Shype's Vicinity Bonus mod (as well as the pronunciation of his name). Unfortunately due to loss of net connection by our guest James `NikNaks93` Nicholls, the Spotlight on his modding work (which includes the World of Civilization Project) had to be canceled. We promise we'll try to get him back on the show soon!
item.itunes:author: Apolyton Civilization Site (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #42: Mix It Up
item.description: In 'Forum Talk' (03m07s), why build farms at all and why no 'building' Espionage in Civilization IV. Featured in the 'Interview' (10m13s) is Bruce 'Beta' Hynes speaking about the Civ IV Beyond the Sword Democracy Game (BtSDG) about to get underway on Apolyton. The first of a two-parter, includes the greater history of DGs in the community. Over in the 'Research Lab' (16m28s), the case for a withdrawal equivalent for defense in the Civ series. Seated in the 'Senate (25m51s) is what is a reasonable gift request and a new Top 10 list by request: Unique Units in Civ IV. Then in the 'Mailbag' (37m16s), feedback o'plenty from Apolyton's 2008 April Fools joke, the launch of a third PolyCast podcast.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: ModCast #07: The Zoo
item.description: In the Artist Sketchpad (03m53s), we discuss NikNak93`s Explorers, Francis I by Ekmek, snafusmith`s Modern Vehicles Pack, asioasioasio`s Industry Factory, an American Civ by Strategyonly and Tony`s own Barack Obama leaderhead. In the Code Corner (23m48s), we look at Grey Fox`s innovative SDK component Unit Fuel Mod. In the Spotlight (30m50s), we interview two of the most prolific Civ4 modders and artists about their work, background and how they learned their skills. Lukasz `asioasioasio` Mackowiak talks about his Polish Empire Mod, Polish Tribes Mod, Map of Poland and of course his massive World War II 1939 Mod, which is still under development for Beyond the Sword. Luke `snafusmith` Smith tell us about his vast catalog of artwork and his Modern Warfare Mod for Warlords and the WWI mod Blood and Iron which he`s currently working on for BtS (which among other things will include the Revolution mod by jdog5000).
item.itunes:author: Apolyton Civilization Site (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast 'Focus: Civilization IV: War of Two Cities'
item.description: A feature interview with representatives of 'Civilization IV: War of Two Cities'' developer Floodgate Entertainment and publisher Oasys Mobile on this mobile-based title. Topic headings are 'Introductions' (01m01s), 'General' (06m10s), 'Technology' (15m06s), 'Setup' (21m48s), 'Civilizations' (25m04s), 'Units' (30m22s), 'Availability' (39m48s), 'Storage' (43m47s) and 'Miscellaneous' (46m20s).
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast Episode 41: The Evil Empire
item.description: In the 'News' (03m50s) Take-Two Interactive asking shareholders not to sell to Electronic Arts, the official Civilization: Revolution website has been launched and patterns of videogame user with survey. Over in the 'Research Lab' (22m59s), in a detailed follow-up from a related discussion on the show previously, whether to extend the Medieval period in Civilization and if so how. Then in the 'Senate' (30m21s) defending against amphibious attack in Civ IV and specialist use: before or after full population?
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: ModCast #06: Where are my Robots?
item.description: In the News (02m23s), we discuss CFC's server getting hacked and a lot of mods and artwork being deleted. In the Artist Sketchpad (10m39s), we look at a Generic Middle Eastern Leader by Amra, Bakuel's Incan Industrial Age Unit Pack, the Fairey Swordfish by The_Coyote and an Evil Lizard Palace by woodelf and winddelay. In the Code Corner (22m10s), we talk about Leonardo's Workshop by GIR and Shqype's Route Restricter (similar to Zebra 9's zRoutes mod as discussed in episode 2). In the Cartography Room (28m47s), we focus on Lokolus's Earth 1643 AD scenario. And in the Spotlight (39m06s), we dig into the Next War scenario that shipped with Civilization IV: Beyond the Sword, to lay a foundation for future discussions on Next War-based mods.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton Civilization Site (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #40: They Do Have Bananas
item.description: In the 'News' (06m27s), what Sid says are the three most important moments in gaming and many-a-preview of Civilization: Revolution. On 'Forum Talk' (12m51s), do you change the espionage slider in Civilization IV: Beyond the Sword, do Permanent Alliances make games too easy and what Civ series unit do you miss the most. In the 'Senate' (25m35s), do you place a Forge in every CivIV city, what to do about 'rat traps' and choosing between building Grenadiers and Riflemen. Playing in the 'Theatre' (34m31s) are some of the biggest blunders in CivIV, led off by a tale from Civilization III.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: ModCast #05: Chuck Norris
item.description: In the Artist Sketchpad (02m45s), we discuss King Hiram of Tyre by Amra, Metal Chariot and Witches by sakhr, Chugginator's Dwarfs, new Palaces from The Navy Seal and Bolsheviks and Chuck Norris by GarretSidzaka. In the Code Corner (21m45s), we talk about Dale's Unique Names Fix, GIR's KGB mod and hacking Civilization onto a mobile phone. In the Spotlight (28m00s), to Follow up on last episode's Code Corner, we invited Steven Jiminez a.k.a. esemjay on as our first-ever guest to talk more about his KFM Converter.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton Civilization Site (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #39: No Sarcasm There at All
item.description: In the 'News' (04m06s), Electronic Arts says that they'll buy Take-Two Interactive, but are told maybe later. Then there's the making of Civilization IV with Lead Designer Soren Johnson. On 'Forum Talk' (14m10s) a greater use for Artillery, particularly defensively, is explored prompted by a listener's suggestion, what to do about the Stealth Destroyer the Civ IV expansion Beyond the Sword introduced, and addressing the obsolescence of Castles in-game. The 'Research Lab' (26m35s) looks at what allure civilization-specific events hold. Then in the 'Senate' (30m36s), is it necessary to improve every tile and does razing make Civ games too easy.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast 'Focus: Civilization Revolution'
item.description: A feature interview with the 2K Community Manager Elizabeth '2K Elizabeth' Tobey on 'Civilization: Revolution' which the company is to publish in June 2008. Topic headings are 'Introduction' (01m03s), 'Reception' (16m07s), 'General' (23m02s), 'Multiplayer' (29m51s), 'Modding' (32m38s), 'Industry' (33m55s) and 'Miscellaneous' (42m09s).
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: ModCast #04: Now With 87.5 Percent Less Ken
item.description: In the News (01m52s), the Civilization: Revolution release date comes up and the start of a how-to modding video series from 'Fall from Heaven''s Derek 'Kael' Paxton. In the Artist's Sketchpad (12m38s), three items of interest this time around: Clockwork Golem by seZereth, SMAC Spartan Cityset by woodelf and Modern Paratrooper v2.0 by the show's very own GarretSidzaka. In the Code Corner (21m03s), the KFM Converter by Esemjay and answering what a KFM file is in the first place. In the Cartography Room (30m12s), the Spiral Galaxy Mapscript by Cephalo is examined. Lastly, in our first Mailbag (37m48s) segment ever we respond to a listener wondering about our covering Galactic Civilizations II works in the future.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #38: This One Time, in Band Camp
item.description: In the 'News' (04m04s), a Civilization: Revolution preview on the Xbox360 platform hold. On 'Forum Talk' (09m34s), going over the unofficial 3.13 patch for Civilization IV: Beyond the Sword at length and why some human players want to be a vassal too. The 'Senate' (21m56s) examines being a technology whore, the merits of Harbours in every coastal city and the zany application of a thief economy. Meanwhile, the 'Research Lab' (32m36s) experiments with natural wonders that's more a la CiVRev than CivIV: BtS's random events and the reincarnated 'Theatre' (38m15s) gives Michael and Dan a platform to discuss a recent Civ IV gameplay experience.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: ModCast #03: The Fat, the Hairy and the Ugly
item.description: In the News (01m53s), we talk about some Civilization: Revolution screenshots, discussing how moddable that game will be and the future of modding in general. In the Artist Sketchpad (13m29s), we look at Simon Bolivar by Ekmek, Lech Walesa by bernie14, the Lockheed U-2 by asioasioasio, a Flamethrower by AlazkanAssassin and an Avro Vulcan by snafusmith. In the Cartography Room (27m45s), a mapscript this week: Continents and Islands by jam3. In the Spotlight (32m29s), we focus on LDiCesare's Tectonics, one of the most sophisticated map scripts available for Civ4, of which v3.15 was recently released.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton Civilization Site (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #37: One Way to Look At It
item.description: In the 'News' (03m57s), a Civilization: Revolution preview on the Nintendo DS and Wii port on indefinite hold; then, asking is Civilization IV: Beyond the Sword a commercial failure with extension on North American PC sales tracking. On 'Forum Talk' (14m13s), governments or civics in a Civ V, desirability for a naval unit (or units) between frigates and destroyers in Civ IV and building Warriors and other outdated units past their obsolescence. The 'Vault' (29m30s) contains an interlude on the 'I'm So Bad at Civ IV that...' list, while the 'Senate' examines the appeal of Civ IV's Marathon and Epic game speeds and 'divine' intervention through WorldBuilder.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: ModCast #02: Accent Support Group
item.description: In the News (01m13s), we call on modders to be guest co-hosts on the show. In the Artist Sketchpad (04m43s), we discuss the Pierre Trudeau leaderhead (or is it Christopher Walken?) by bernie14, Grave's Saddam Hussein leaderhead (based on work of Iloveplayciv) and the Villistas unit by C. Roland. In Code Corner (18m57s) a segment on Zebra 9's zRoutes mod, or is it a Python vs C++ debate? Also, we talk about the Civ Changer SDK component by Dale. In the Spotlight (30m12s), we discuss the Defense mod that came with Beyond the Sword. And finally in the Mailbag (40m10s), we go through the feedback we got for Episode #1.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton Civilization Site (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #36: Too Much Information
item.description: In the 'News' (03m49s), reflecting on Sid Meier set to receive a Lifetime Achievement Award. On 'Forum Talk' (08m44s), the 'slow' Civilization IV and 'fast' Alpha Centauri when it comes to combat and how could a Civilization be better than Civ IV. Over in the 'Research Lab' (28m13s), nine proposed tenets for Civ IV's religions, using patrolling to beef up the sentry system and a place for tribal villages of the sea.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: ModCast #01: The Personification of Evil
item.description: Welcome to the inaugural episode of a new Civilization podcast, devoted entirely to modding the series. Topics: In the News (00m57s), we have a detailed discussion about ModCast: what will it be, how did it come about and who's making it? Includes a big announcement by Kenneth. Finally (at 19m22s), we discuss the Firaxis modding contest for Civ4. In the Artist Sketchpad (26m16s), we talk about Tony's Realistic George Bush leaderhead and a Necromancer unit for Civilization III by Plotinus. In the Code Corner (35m09s) we focused on the first release of Dales Combat Mod for Beyond the Sword, which include the Civ Customiser, Scorched Earth and Bombing Missions SDK component mods (please mind that two major updates were released between our recording and this episode's release, some of the things discussed are already out of date).
item.itunes:author: Apolyton Civilization Site (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #35: By Popular Request
item.description: In the News (06m05s), 'Wreaking Havoc' on our Children's Education and Roman History 'The Civilized Way'. Over in Forum Talk (14m51s), post-Beyond the Sword Favourite Traits and Leaders and Criticizing Alternate Traits as Requested. Then in Mailbag (35m54s), feedback on 2007 Christmas Special.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast Christmas Special 2007: Girls Playing Civ
item.description: It's true that girls other than MAKI play Civ and this is the proof. First-time guest co-hosts ANNALEE, GLORIA and KELLY round out an all-female panel special. As the show's Christmas edition, it's 50% longer than your standard episode. As the four play into the stereotype that women hop topics every few minutes, the combination allows them to discuss dozens of topics on the venerable game series. Their secrets are out!
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #34: Don't Drink and Civ
item.description: METHOS is back and in need of some direction. He also displays behaviour that reminds DAN, WOUTER and MAKI of their absent colleague and point it out several times over. DAN asks WOUTER to provide details on some feedback he gave in response to the last episode and vaguely alludes to something different coming in the next. WOUTER and MAKI also hint at it, but METHOS is still not certain what they're getting at.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #33: Send In the Dancing Girls
item.description: DAN gives IMRAN pause to think that MAKI may be looking to change her nickname while returning guest ALEX dares to confirm a reality other than the one they're in. There is also a significant-and-not-so-significant point as to why this episode's number is worth noting. Something about the rarest resource combo makes it into the chatter and then someone learns that the no singing rule is a bit of an exclusive club.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #32: Quite Enough of That
item.description: After guest co-hosts MATT and LEE become acquainted, IMRAN does not wait another moment to talk about a comparison between an in-game leader and a commercial entity. The two guests, DAN, WOUTER and MAKI let him take the lead after which DAN provides a similar example. A quickly becoming popular screenshot from an upcoming game makes a verbal appearance, and how long to play a turn is explored in humourous depth.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #31: Is This Where I Hit Mute?
item.description: JOE makes a noise that catches the attention of first IMRAN, then MAKI, and also apparently WOUTER by association. DAN has a ditty for WOUTER and his admirer, though IMRAN has a theory about their identity that is very much his own. A bit of barbarian obsession ensues on religion founding and vassalization, but DAN also raises a topic that leaves all others speechless.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #30: Let There Be Shiny
item.description: OSCAR dares question the shiny KEN identifies and DAN acknowledges while TONY and WOUTER stay out of it. DAN and OSCAR later get serious about interpreting a forum thread title in a manner other than was intended but TONY just has to take it one step too far. He is then one to bring up a topic for its title that is taken more literally to which OSCAR is desperate to find a solution for.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #29: Can of Worms
item.description: KEN prompts TONY and OSCAR to admit that they already knew of each other, followed by WOUTER calling for a quick change of subject after DAN alludes to a taboo subject. OSCAR brings up not one but two luscious leaders in which TONY partakes, and then DAN asks OSCAR just how well he knew what he had gotten himself into now.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #28: CivJunction, What's Your Function?
item.description: From a change in expectations to what forum threads he really likes to see, METHOS makes an impression though his pronunciation of MAKI's handle has to be heard to be believed. The two along with DAN, WOUTER and IMRAN aim to differentiate between three easily familiar terms and IMRAN sings a song with an eerily familiar ring to it. Elsewhere DAN asks METHOS many questions and WOUTER clarifies his names.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #27: Don't Say Simplified (Part 2)
item.description: No rest for the weird and wired. DORIAN gets a refreshment while BARRY is ready to continue; this prompts IMRAN to render assistance and MAKI to offer the response. MATT's speechless, DAN may have found a new means through which to get sponsorship for the show, and WOUTER gets a one-worded answer to a many-worded question.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #26: Catch the Civolution (Part 1)
item.description: DAN credits WOUTER but sets him up in the process, IMRAN suggests why BARRY and DORIAN may really be present while MAKI and MATT undoubtedly shake their heads in amazement. After a shot is made at a mode of multiplayer, why one person wants to swear and another would not be offended by it. It also appears as though a warning while acknowledged went unheeded.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #25: One List to Guide Them All
item.description: It's the show's silver episode anniversary, so the main topic of conversation is as extensive as it is extended. DANQ, MAKI, IMRAN, MING, SOLVER and DANT are back where two of them introduce this outing. Several other co-hosts make cameo appearances of a sort as previously unpublished clips of them are vaulted forward where a theme may or may not play a part. Here's to still being forever suggestively young!
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #24: Let's Get It On
item.description: IMRAN is so distracted by where MAKI has been that he doesn't quite get MING's introduction right. He reluctantly greets DANQ, optimistically DANT, and nudges SOLVER to say hello. Phone ringing reminds IMRAN of a certain intro, and DANQ gets him back in focus by leading in doing something MAKI would rather forget. MING then rubs it in. IMRAN can't bring himself to insult as usual but takes another low road instead.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #23: Falling Off the Dragon
item.description: Guest co-hosts outnumber regular panelists with DAN and WOUTER joined by first-timers DEREK, TONY and the returning MARK. DEREK talks about how not to romance a woman and his colourful gaming roots which has TONY scared, DAN and WOUTER speechless and MARK proposing a drastic solution. They all take a moment to also reflect on the atmosphere of the show and who will regret missing out on all the fun.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #22: Going Above and Beyond
item.description: A Firaxian joins the panel for the first time! JON speaks for himself, while he and DAN take turns speaking for an absent party. A dedication for a certain reviewer of and your questions on Civilization IV: Beyond the Sword -- plus those from the regular co-hosts' -- are answered! Ultimately DAN prompts JON into an admission of a secret. WOUTER moans, MAKI runs and IMRAN's holding the door for anyone who wants to follow him.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #21: Goody, Those Huts Are Mine
item.description: MAKI attempts to keep DAN, IMRAN and returning guest co-host KENNETH at bay when discussing who the most beaudacious babe in Civilization IV: Beyond the Sword is, but for some reason it's a recurring topic. IMRAN may sound different, but between his keyboard and comments it's not difficult to discern it's the same IMRAN. A pre-Settler MOD cannot keep DAN and IMRAN from dragging MAKI into the babe chatter.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #20: You Must Whip It
item.description: At the outset IAN quickly establishes that he has listened to past episodes, and the returning IMRAN starts to compensate for being away for so long. The more things change, the more they stay the same for he gets DAN and MAKI's names right but not WOUTER's... but he does offer an explanation for once though. IMRAN then takes another go at getting hatemail.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #19: And On and On (Part 2)
item.description: Returning guest co-host COSTAS is laughing with everyone and at himself, while WOUTER gets a lesson on different worlds from MAKI. After yet more Beyond the Sword chatter DAN spoils so-called upcoming coverage on this expansion, WOUTER falls back into old habits, COSTAS asks about naming a certain something and it's MAKI's turn to talk about something shiny.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #18: The More The Better (Part 1)
item.description: The first of a two-part Beyond the Sword news extravaganza! MAKI's waking up, DAN's scaring WOUTER and guest co-host DALE can't wait to share exclusive goodies on his contribution to this second CivIV expansion pack. Not long after DAN makes it easier for MAKI to accept a certain reality by taking the blame while worrying WOUTER may not be as observant as previously thought.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #17: A Little Bit More Coherent
item.description: Returning and first-time guest co-hosts RICH and JOE respectively are quickly put to work. DAN's busy singing a little something from a song referenced on Apolyton's forums and reading excerpts of twisted quote sayings from CFC, while WOUTER makes a move on MAKI. After the five reflect on several of the show's more vocal naysayers, RICH helps MAKI out of a jam and JOE reveals another effort at participation.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #16: Something to Talk About
item.description: DAN and IMRAN may mark their return, but WOUTER leaves his mark with controversy from the get-go. IMRAN and guest co-host BRUCE each pick up on this practice later, but not before DAN runs through a personalized checklist. Then when MAKI has a question for DAN, IMRAN is the one who gladly answers it. WOUTER closes the show with a classic.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #15: All Your Interview Are Belong To Us
item.description: DAN's out on a secret mission and IMRAN dropped out last-minute, but KENNETH makes his second appearance in a row to help hold the fort together with extra shiny MAKI and WOUTER, who's still working on his evil laugh. KENNETH looks at the Giant Death Robots in Beyond the Sword while MAKI's admiring her forests and WOUTER is ranting about obscure Indonesian kingdoms.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #14: Much Rambling
item.description: IMRAN introduces WOUTER and his other fellow co-hosts, but not before doing the same for himself. As guest co-host KENNETH takes his first step towards squeezing one of the core team members out, DAN makes note of MAKI's aptly renamed blog and the conversation takes... expected turns. After MAKI and KENNETH trade barbs over a long-running Democracy Game (DG), IMRAN leads all in a calming prayer.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #13: Set to Vibrate
item.description: DAN's here, WOUTER's back, MAKI's on time, IMRAN makes his glorious/gory return and PROVOST HARRISON works to make a name for himself to be able to return at some point in the future. DAN names a power for himself and each of his fellow co-hosts, but some are looking to swap or suggest alternatives altogether. IMRAN leads this crew in the closing, though others do what they can to take over the spotlight.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #12: Beyond the Dozen
item.description: Not long after the public announcement of the Civilization IV expansion Beyond the Sword comes the dozenth episode of the series with nearly as many co-hosts! This celebratory installment features DAN and a most fashionably late MAKI with MING, GRANDPA TROLL, KEYGEN, METALITURTLE, OZZYKP, SNOTTY and CAPTVK. Some are letting their voices be heard by the community for the first time. Join the anticipatory party!
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #11: Full Screen Mode
item.description: IMRAN has to cancel at the last moment, but DAN manages to quickly get a hold of BLAKE and agreed to fill in! He is justly rewarded for this (or not). MAKI's here but WOUTER was not able to check in at all, and DAN offers his theory on that. Later he looks more at a rich people list and what any of the co-hosts being on that list would have resulted in. DAN then leads the trio in farewell and somehow manages to compliment himself.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #10: Double Digits
item.description: WOUTER returns to the fold with some ribbing, while it is presumed IMRAN got "the call" that is keeping him away. DAN corrects himself after being called on for terminology misue while MAKI tries to capitalize on the event. Later DAN and MAKI try to cite a word that best represents themselves, but WOUTER finds that his is already picked out for him.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #09: Strategies Involved
item.description: The prize for the person who got up the earliest their time to participate goes to guest co-host BLAKE. IMRAN tries to pretend that he's not there, but DAN soon puts him in his place. Fresh from a response to an an apology call, later listen to who's singing now and what part BLAKE didn't want cut (and isn't) from the show. All the while MAKALUHA takes these events and more in stride.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #08: Go Figure
item.description: Guest co-host SAVA knows the name of the show he is appearing on, but not one of the regular co-hosts it seems. DANQ goes out of his way to address how he will not address SAVA. SAVA then drops reference to a well-known member in Civ community in an effort to underlie his importance but fails. Later IMRAN can't name just one of his problems so he refers to them all. He then demonstrates why singing may be one of them.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #07: The Lucky One
item.description: MAKALUHA returns though her explanation for her absence is met with skepticism. IMRAN is busy elsewhere and LOCUTUS is no where to be found, so in guest co-hosting DAUPHIN starts the "name game" of those who listen to the show only to bring it down. Later, learn how two of the co-hosts tactfully tie a movie mention to Civ. A certain spamming of forums and how to resolve the matter is also talked about. The last word goes to DAUPHIN.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #06: Happy New Civving
item.description: When LOCUTUS is missing in action and MAKALUHA pre-occupied, DANQ and IMRAN take the reigns as a dynamic duo once again. The show's value for insomniacs and a listener's interest in more varied discussions are addressed in the opening minutes. Just before ending time, a select choice of spam is made fun of including a zinger or two. Perhaps predictably, the topic of conversation gets back to... basics.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #05: Yuletide Spirit
item.description: With MAKALUHA under the weather and IMRAN otherwise engaged, DANQ and LOCUTUS are joined by the show's first guest co-host DROGUE. DROGUE wastes no time in bringing up something that was news... fourteen months ago. Later he brings up both DANQ's avatar and Apolyton's eighth birthday logo. Under the wire this prolific individual reflects on allowing the community to choose his new custom forum title.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #04: Two by Two
item.description: With LOCUTUS at a Dutch PolyMeet and MAKI reportedly dating some admirers, DANQ and IMRAN are left to hold down the fort outpost. Near the finish, DANQ finds himself unusually agreeing with IMRAN when he suggests a shoutout to a number of users on Apolyton's forums for a particular reason. IMRAN then directs some words to a nameless naysayer and asks a question that makes DANQ grateful to be saved by the theme song.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #03: The View From Here
item.description: DANQ is confused, IMRAN is misleading, MAKI is surprised and LOCUTUS takes it all in at the start. Later IMRAN talks about the value of his name that could have been, and then the co-hosts address one of the show's more vocal audience members in its forum during which DANQ's geek level apparently suffers a minor blow. Soon IMRAN focuses attention back on himself for getting stuck on a catchphrase and not signing-off without it.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #02: Second Time Around
item.description: The pressure is on to follow-up the premiere with another strong start... so the co-hosts begin by talking about the reception to the first episode instead! IMRAN manages to catch DANQ's ire but DANQ doesn't get mad: he gets even. Later, LOCUTUS' obsession with a particular weakness surfaces again to denegerate discussion even further. Amazingly, content manages to squeeze itself in between.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)

item.title: PolyCast #01: Let's Get It Started
item.description: The episode that launched the series. IMRAN introduces himself and his fellow co-hosts but very quickly DANQ takes the opportunity to offer a public service netiquette lesson on email usage. At the end, DANQ offers not only sets up an insult at his own expense, but also explains the supposed origins of the name of the show. Best to take the tale with a few grains of salt.
item.itunes:author: Apolyton CS (https://apolyton.net)
